options.text: Monitors the controlled parameter, calculates an error, corrects the error
Calculates an error, corrects the error, does not provide feedback
Monitors an error, corrects the error
Monitors an independent parameter, calculates an error, corrects the error

variant.question: An automatic pilot is a system which can ensure the functions of:

options.text: piloting and guidance of an aircraft in both the horizontal and vertical planes.
piloting from take-off to landing without any action from human pilot.
piloting only.
navigation.

variant.question: With respect to an autopilot, the term 'self-induced oscillation' refers to...

options.text: oscillation caused by erroneous autopilot systems.
aircraft vibration triggered by exceeding VMO or MMO.
abnormal pilot interaction with manual flight controls.
manual flight control inputs exceeding structural limitations.

variant.question: A closed loop control system in which a small power input controls a much larger power output in a strictly proportionate manner is known as

options.text: a servomechanism.
an amplifier.
a feedback control circuit.
an autopilot.

variant.question: What is the basic principle of a closed loop system?

options.text: Measurement of the controlled variable, calculation of the control error, and adjustment of the controlled variable to reduce/remove the control error.
Adjustment of the controlled variable based on a fixed setting.
Measurement of an independent variable, calculation of the control error, and adjustment of the controlled variable to reduce/remove the control error.
Calculation of the control error, adjustment of the controlled variable to reduce/remove the control error, and without feedback.

variant.question: What is meant by pilot-induced oscillations in Automatic Flight Control Systems?

options.text: Anomalous interactions between the pilot and the aircraft.
Oscillations caused by errors in the autopilot programming.
Airframe vibration due to exceeding VMO/MMO.
Disturbances to the flight path of the aeroplane due to turbulence.

variant.question: An inner loop control system is one in which

options.text: autostabilization is provided about a single axis.
all three axes of movement in flight are sensed and the appropriate actuator is selected.
a torque limiter controls the aircraft in pitch.
only roll control can be achieved.

variant.question: In a closed loop control system,

options.text: The regulator processes the difference between target and corrected actual value according to its control laws.
The sensed actual value is compared to the target value, and the result is fed to an error detector.
A feedback loop reports the commands to the regulating element back to the comparator, which creates a new deviation signal.
Flight crew cannot enter target values manually; these are automatically provided by systems such as the FMS.
